name: Chanse LaShai
text:
Couple years back, brought in my vehicle and asked them to check over everything to make sure it would be good for a 1500 mile journey. They only took 30 minutes, topped my fluids, and sent me on my way with the all-clear. Went elsewhere for a second opinion and they were shocked that Gill's blatantly missed (or didn't even check) that I had some serious suspension issues as well as separating tires.

Fast forward to earlier this year. Boyfriend's new car had a clutch failure. Ordered a conversion kit online to do ourselves. After not being able to put it back together it was brought to Gill's. It turned out the company we ordered from sent us the wrong kit. Gill's said it would be a week or so. After hearing nothing, had to call and see where progress was, got some excuse about why it wasn't done yet. Okay, not a big deal but should have been kept up to date. Week after week of not being kept up to date, and hearing excuse after excuse as to why, 2 months later car is ready. Car feels great, except for a weird rumbling sensation that wasn't there before. Oh well, not sure what it is. Notice a bolt just sitting in the console that wasn't there before. Turns out they didn't even connect the steering column. Thank goodness it didn't give out and KILL US while driving down 280 for the week we couldn't figure out the rumbling/random bolt. Won't ever return, and will always warn people from here on out.

name: April Renfro
text: I purchased an engine from here, was guaranteed motor was good. Paid for it over the phone and picked it up the next day. After getting the motor in it was knocking called and talked to a lady who said owner wasn’t in and he’ll give me a call back, he never called me back. I called a couple days later and he answered I let him know what was going on and he said you only have a 30 day warranty, when in fact my paperwork states I had 60. Thank god I had kept the receipt. He told me I had to fill out the warranty paperwork and present receipts. Ok no problem but on the warranty form it states that the timing belt needs to be replaced, this engine has a chain. He informed me that regardless belt or chain it’s all the same. Well I got some news from you buddy there not, a chain shouldn’t have to be serviced under normal conditions, a belt yes I agree it does. But if the motor is knocking that has nothing to do with it. This is a fair warning for anyone purchasing from here he will not refund your money and will think of any way possible not too, and he uses the square app which makes things much harder to get a refund through your credit card. But I am happy to say after over 8 months I have received my refund and hope this guy flies out of business and really feels it. I tried to do the rite thing and not go through my card company but in the end they took care of it. And I really hope this guy goes out of business.

resp.text: Hi April.  We do not have a record of you ever purchasing anything with us.  We recommend that if any item is purchased from American Salvage and is under warranty that it be brought back to our location for inspection.

text: Saturday afternoon (4/3/21) I pulled in there to purchase a used tire for my Buick.  The staff was friendly enough, but the price was a little steep $51.50 but, I paid it because I was in need. Drove straight home from there. (about 3miles). Woke up Sunday morning and it was flat. Aired it up enough to get it back up there Monday morning..  When I got there and tell them the problem they took the tire off and said my valve stem was bad and charged me $20 to replace the valve stem. I thought all was good, woke up Tuesday morning it was flat again. I called & spoke to Chris who told me that it was more than likely a cracked rim and there was nothing he could do about it. Today...FRIDAY, I took off work to take my car to Fortners. They first told me that the tire was the wrong size. Then when they got it off the rim they showed me 4 plugs where the tire had been repaired 4 times, previously. For $30 I got an almost perfect Firestone tire, that was the right size with alot of tread. The actions and unprofessionalism at Chris Tires/Havana Tires was ridiculous and I intend to call the BETTER BUSINESS BUREAU.

name: Kathryn Davis
text: I had a trip to Birmingham the next day to take my daughter to her surgery follow up appointment, so I came in the night before to purchase four good used tires. There were only two employees working at the time an I guess they got overwhelmed because more people were in need of service; mind you I was the first customer an they should have been working on my car, but the guy kept stopping to help other people that had pulled up. So finally I had enough an asked the guy to please finish with my car, because I had to go rest before getting on the road (at that time I had been there close to 2 hours). So he did, an I was on my way. We made it through Montgomery without any problems, an then I was awaken by a loud noise, screeching tire sounds, and the sight of my front driver tire rolling away parallel to my truck, heading towards the grassy median. By the grace of God we were not hurt. The inside of the rim was shredded, the bolts were gone, the studs ate up. All this was caused by the a negligent employee that didn't properly tighten the bolts to secure the tire. I spoke with the owner about getting help, but none was offered, an he even tried placing the blame somewhere else. But I will never give Chris Tires anymore of my money/business nor will I recommend them to anyone. I spent over $600 to have my car fixed. I even checked the other tires an the bolts were not secure on them either. Lesson learned, u can't support everyone. I hate that I have to give them one 🌟😡 cause they don't deserve that.

text: While traveling, we had a bad alternator. The shop did a great job with the repair and made a bad situation, much better.  Gary was super friendly and helpful.

name: Michelle Kuznicki
text:
I was heading to Gulf Shores, AL from Hazel Green, AL when my 2014 Jeep took a nosedive in Prattville, AL. After taking it to a Jeep dealership up there, and getting the call that nothing was wrong diagnostically and to come get my vehicle, I started my journey to Gulf Shores once again the next day.

However, about an hour into my drive my Jeep failed again. I chose D and D Automotive at random because I was in the middle of nowhere and had zero clue about my surroundings. I am so glad I did.

After my insurance company got me safely to their shop via tow truck, both Mr. Gary and Joe helped diagnose the issue (it was in fact the alternator), explained the repair to me, checked on me several times (mind you, I was in their shop for close to 6 hours with no where to go), and were incredibly knowledgeable about their trade.

I grew up around cars and can tell pretty quickly when people are in this business to rip off those in need and I can say, without-a-doubt, this shop genuinely cares about their patrons and those they serve. They could have *easily* waited to work on my car the next day but they were immediate in their desire to help and get me back on the road.

I could not be more thankful for their help and cannot recommend them enough. Hearts of gold and quality work, D and D Automotive is the place to go.

resp.text: Michelle, thank you so much for the positive feedback. We appreciate the 5 STARS!  We are so glad we would get you back on the road.   We appreciate your business and let us know if we can ever assist you again. Safe travels!

name: John Porter
text:
Phenomenal, honest, inexpensive care, they go the extra mile...actually it was closer to ten miles, I was halfway to Greenvile when my idler bearing seized on my Mercedes Benz 350 SLK, shredding my serpentine belt and leaving me properly stranded at Grace Garland exit. Stuck like chuck and the nearest taxi? Montgomery.  Ouch. Gary got the parts to me and got me back up in running in no time, and to say they were fair, well my friend, that is an understatement. Knowledgeable, fast, friendly and trustworthy is what I know about D&D. Hands down they are the absolute best, and in my case saved the day, and what would have been a long cold night on the side of I65. Thank you Gary and D&D, I owe you guys breakfast next time I'm up that way. AAA doesn't hold a candle to D&D 10/10 would not hesitate to use them again or recommend them to anyone, anytime.
John  B Porter
SysAdmin
Airbus Americas Inc
Mobile Engineering  Center

text: Very honest staff. I own a business that could be considered by some to be "competition" since we repair wheels. They are in business to sell wheels. I can't count the times that we have gotten customers because the staff referred them to us. Someone may not know that a wheel can be repaired so they go to them to buy a new one. Instead they will tell them about my company and save their customer money. Some may think that is crazy for them to do but I know that in business that will get you even further.  Most businesses are more concerned with the money now instead of looking at the bigger picture and knowing that doing right by the customer will ultimately make you more in the end! Keep up the great work guys!

text: I called because our travel trailer had a broken axle.  What a responsive group of people and so very kind.  We are still waiting on some parts to come in from Dexter, but they have been nothing but wonderful so far.  Great there are such good people still on this earth.

name: Larry White
text: Came out in a timely manner, saved me from having to get a tow truck when they have tow trucks. Didn’t just fix the problem, but also adjusted my trailer brakes bcuz he saw an axle sticking with no charge. Looked over my truck and found other problems as well. Worked all day until 4 am trying to fix my truck bcuz my driver was under a load. Checked my boxes and saw they both was low in gear oil. Topped them off and told me I had a yoke seal leak and a drive axle leak. Didn’t charge me for the oil he put in my truck. Cut down the price so I could get everything fixed bcuz he didn’t want me having problems down on the road. Sent pictures of all the malfunctioning parts and sent pictures of the new parts once installed. Called and texted the next day to make sure everything was going fine. Charged me less than what I would’ve got charged anywhere else knowingly bcuz my money was funny due to me just paying  to get my motor rebuilt by another mechanic. Told me the other problems I needed to get done in the future. I know honest mechanics are hard to come by but I have been blessed to find one and will continue doing business with this knowledgeable and honest family owned mechanic shop.  Thanks Adam!

text: These guys are awesome! Had a catastrophic wheel failure while towing a trailer at about 11 PM in the rain. These guys came and towed both my truck and trailer to their shop quickly and professionally. They were going to take me to a hotel for the night but when they asked where I was headed and found out I had a plane to catch the next day to see family they immediately got work on my vehicle (it was almost midnight at this point). They found enough lug nuts to fit my oversized Land Rover wheels and got me back on the road that night! Top notch service and some genuinely good people. Recommend highly!

name: Dale Kiddy
text:
Just want to say that you will never find a better group of people than the family of Tigerstate Truck and Trailer.  After being left broke down on the shoulder of the road by another repair company.  Adam,  William and Holly went the extra mile to get my truck and trailer towed to their location and helped me secure a motel for the night.  The next morning they picked me up and to the shop so  another driver could continue with the load. (This was a Sunday morning). Adam did a check of the truck and found it was a transmission failure . They made sure that I had a room for Sunday .
On Monday they went over 100 miles each way to get a transmission and other parts and had me back on the road at a very reasonable price on Tuesday.
This is a family owned company and very professional and I would highly recommend them.  If you need anything stop by and Jo ,Holly, Adam and William and have a cup of coffee.

resp.text:
Hi Mikel,

Thank you for your positive review. Shane does his best to take work as we get it in, as we schedule work on a first-come-first-served basis, but sometimes we make a judgment call based on who is waiting and who isn't and it just doesn't pan out like we'd prefer, this coupled with our staffing being affected by COVID has made it a little tough to get people in and out as fast as we can normally, so I apologize for the delay.

I hope we can make it up to you next time! Thanks again!

text: I gave one star because the girl at front is very sweet and there was a helpful guy, but we left car on a Wednesday at 10am. The other mechanics had jobs and they couldn't get to mine...nothing! They need a mechanic for minor jobs like mine (bearings to be replaced) and other mechanics for the bigger jobs...if you got one car and need it done same or next day or actually in three ...don't go here! I feel the mechanic that looked at the car should have just fixed it. Oh they were supposed to have called as well..no such thing happened, the mechanic just didn't want to do the job! I have never taken a car somewhere where they did not have their stuff together like this place! Never even called for a status update or to tell us anything about the car! name: Joe Shultz
text:
I went there for a new water pump for a Chevy SUV. A new water pump was installed, but didn't last 100 miles. I returned the vehicle only to have the auto shop refuse to replace the water pump free of charge. I removed the water pump that weekend to find they cross threaded the new water pump and warped the unit. No wonder it did not function properly. After re-tapping a couple of screws and several hours out of my Saturday I replaced the new pump myself. Now I am out the price of another water pump, thanks a lot.

Many people do not know this, but each repair job has an attached amount of time associated with it. So, if an auto center changes your brakes in 30 min but the book says it takes 1.5 hours, then the shop charges you for the extra hour as an extra rake. Now, I do not mind paying the extra as long as the quality matches. This shop may do quick work, but it is not at the quality I am paying for. Poor value given, and they would not make it right either. Basically the repair guy did not remove all the necessary components (like a radiator) to save some time and shoved the water pump in at an angle.

I will never use them again.

name: Heather M
text: Griffin is a lifesaver! My truck blew a spark plug and I had two kids with me along with my husband. We were about 300 miles from home! I thought we were stranded and repair was going to cost a fortune. Griffin used his OWN vehicle to drive 3 exits up to assist us. He was able to get the undamaged spark plug back in and also brought us a brand new coil pack and put it in. He did this repair out of the kindness of his heart and we cannot thank him enough! He was honest from the get go. He could have told us the truck needed a new head or worse and made a ton of money, but he fixed the problem quickly and didn't charge us a fractuon of what he could have! Thank you Griffin, you were our Angel! His shop may be behind sometimes, but he is worth the wait if you want an honest mechanic!

name: Sheree Lewis
text: New owner, great guy great work! I recommend this place for all your auto work .

name: Travis Gibbs
text:
I brought my car and truck to them when they first opened. They fixed both and stuck to fair estimate.

I wouldn't do business with them now after my last experience.

Month 1 & 2
Our car needed a new engine. The shop owner wanted to get an engine from his supplying junkyard. He missed one that became available. This process took about 2 weeks before we decided to find an engine ourselves which he was not happy with but agreed to. He said they could have it put in within a 3 day period. The engine company we bought from needed it done in 10 days for warranty purposes. Griffith used all of the 10 days to because other cars came in front of me while we had to wait on engine. They finally got it in and started but had to send to dealership because the car went into anti-theft mode and wouldn't start. We had to actually arrange the drop off to the dealership ourselves. I feel like we were running his business for him because he was almost never there. The employees even mentioned that problem in passing.

Month 3
We become worried after not hearing anything from dealership or Griffin for about 2.5ish weeks. I had to contact dealership for them to tell me that they told Griffin that the car needed a major fuse panel that could be $1200+. I called Griffin to tell him I approved the install because we really needed the car. It's month 3 folks!

Is it Month 4? Getting close anyway.
We had to go ourselves to the dealership to confront them about not getting to our car. This should be Griffin's job. The dealership says that the part didn't fix the problem. Car still doesn't work. We decide to give up because the car needed another part for $2400 to "maybe" fix. We decide to just give up. Dealership is trying to get more money from us even though they didn't fix the problem. Griffin is trying to put that on us. We said we would pay for his time, but does this seem fair? Griffin himself might be a knowledgable mechanic, but he is a rookie business owner with no organization or management skills of his people.  He wasted a huge amount of our time (3+months), money ($6000+) and stressed my wife and I to no end. We are going to have to scrap our car with a new engine that doesn't run.

They do good oil changes and put a muffler on another car we brought, but he also made me pay for the part up front which shows bad business to me as well.

* FINAL RESULT
paid griffin $1400 because the car ended up not working out. He said he made no money and it would have been $2000 if it had worked + whatever it would be to charge AC. When we walked in to pay he didn't even recognize us. My wife and I talked to this guy several times in person and on phone. The waiting area had mice running around too FYI if you are scared of them. After that we went to the dealer shop that had our car and basically gave it to the tech working on it. he paid for the dealer work and gave us a little cash. When we went to clean the car out I noticed that the driver seat leather looked very dirty and worn. Griffin said he was sorry.

name: Kristina Garrison
text: I am honestly disappointed, this shop has Amazing POTENTIAL. However, I don't feel it is being ran efficiently. I have called with no answer, mupltiple occasions. I also have the concern of the child/childern that are running through shop all day, most days. I have also had to keep from hitting many toys, many times. I believe the shop is in an amazing location, and again has all potential in the wprld. Unfourtnally, right now, I wouldn't recommend it.

name: Chris Ruffin
text:
I moved to McCalla in March of 2015. I was looking for a dependable repair shop that did quality work and that I could become a repeat customer with. I chose Griffin Automotive because they are ASE certified and after using them with 3 vehicles (06 Nissan Altima, 05 Chevy Silverado, & 2015 Nissan Altima) I have had no complaints with them.

They do great work, and are realistic with their estimates. If you are looking for a repair shop with a quick turnaround (meaning hours instead of days) then this may not be the shop for you, but I have a spare vehicle and can leave the vehicle for repairs.  They typically tell me that they have other vehicles in front of mine, but will look at it as soon as they get a free moment. I have sent my cars or truck to them at least 9 times (using both the overnight drop box and just bringing it in) and have only waited longer than a day once (and that was because the part got their late in the evening and I picked it up after work the next day)

I have had multiple types of jobs: brakes pads for Altima and Silverado, rotors for Altima and Silverado,, brake drums for Silverado, oil change for Altima and Silverado, window regulator replacement on Silverado, oil leak repair on Altima, engine mounts on Altima, transfer case replacement Silverado 4x4, along with other normal maintenance type items

name: Gretchen Kindrick
text: Very nice people, but first they couldn't locate the oil filter on my car.  It took two of them an hour, and then I was charged $52 for a simple oil change. I doubt I return.
